definitions.definition: a small container made of paper or card in which goods are packed for selling
a small object wrapped in paper or put into a thick envelope so that it can be sent by mail, carried easily or given as a present

examples.text: A packet of photographs arrived with the mail.

definitions.definition: a closed plastic or paper package that contains a very small amount of liquid or a powder

examples.text: a packet of instant cocoa mix
That car must have cost a packet.

definitions.definition: a piece of information that forms part of a message sent through a computer network

examples.text: The data transmission is split into a number of packets of equal size.

definitions.definition: a set of documents that are supplied together for a particular purpose

examples.text: My kids have summer math packets from their schools.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: diminutive of pack, perhaps from Anglo-Norman French; compare with Anglo-Latin paccettum.
